name: Universal Timeline Manager
overview: Chronological playlists for cinematic universes in Jellyfin via JSON configuration.
description: Creates chronological playlists for multiple cinematic universes (Marvel, DC, Star Wars, etc.) based on JSON configuration files. Features Provider_ID matching with TMDB/IMDB for accurate content identification, mixed content support (movies + TV episodes), and comprehensive error handling. Simple JSON-based configuration with clear documentation and examples provided in the plugin configuration page.

versions.changelog:
## v0.7.0 - UI Playlist Creator

### Major Features
- Visual Playlist Creator - Create playlists through UI without writing JSON
- Content Search - Search your Jellyfin library by title with real-time results
- Drag-free Reordering - Use up/down buttons to arrange items in preferred order
- Universe Delete - Delete universe files directly from Universe Manager
- Form Validation - Inline validation for playlist keys and names
- One-Click Creation - Create Jellyfin playlists directly from the UI

### New API Endpoints
- GET /Timeline/Search - Search library for movies and episodes by title
- Returns enriched results with provider IDs, year, type, and metadata

### UI Improvements
- New Playlist Creator section with step-by-step workflow
- Search interface with debouncing (300ms) for smooth experience
- Item list with position numbers and metadata display
- Delete buttons for universes in Universe Manager
- Button state management (disabled when invalid)
- Success/error messages with clear feedback

### Technical Details
- ContentSearchService with 42 unit tests
- ContentSearchController with full error handling
- Service registration via dependency injection
- Search supports both movies and TV episodes
- Season number prompt for TV episodes
- Validates playlist keys (no spaces/special chars)

### Workflow
1. Click Create New Playlist
2. Enter playlist key and name
3. Search for content and add items
4. Reorder items with up/down buttons
5. Save as universe file
6. Create Jellyfin playlist with one click

**Breaking Changes:** None - fully backward compatible

## v0.6.0 - Multi-Universe Configuration System

### Major Features
- **Multi-File Universe System** — Each universe stored as separate JSON file in /config/universes/
- **Automatic Migration** — Seamlessly migrates legacy single-file configurations on startup
- **Universe Manager Web UI** — Select, edit, and manage universes directly in browser
- **Selective Processing** — Create playlists for specific universes or all at once
- **JSON Editor** — Edit configurations with real-time validation and error feedback

### New API Endpoints
- GET /Timeline/Universes — List all available universes
- GET /Timeline/Universes/{filename} — Get specific universe content
- POST /Timeline/Universes/{filename} — Save/update universe
- DELETE /Timeline/Universes/{filename} — Delete universe
- POST /Timeline/CreatePlaylists — Now supports selective universe processing

### Technical Improvements
- Service registration with dependency injection
- Comprehensive error handling and logging
- Backward compatibility with legacy format
- Security: filename validation prevents directory traversal
- Performance: efficient file operations with atomic writes

### Migration
- Automatic on plugin startup
- Creates backup of old config (timeline_manager_config.json.backup)
- Zero manual intervention required
- 100% success rate tested with 78-item MCU configuration

**Breaking Changes:** None - fully backward compatible

## v0.5.2 - Web UI & Code Cleanup

### New Features
- Web UI Enhancements - Clean configuration page with playlist management
- Playlist Management - View and delete playlists directly from web UI
- Real-time Feedback - Button shows creating state with success/error messages
- Auto-refresh - Playlist list automatically refreshes after creation

### Code Cleanup
- Removed Python Dependencies - No longer requires Python or external scripts
- Removed 46+ Redundant Files - Cleaned up test scripts, debug files, old docs
- Simplified API - Removed unused endpoints (ValidateApiKey, CheckPythonAvailability, ExecutePlaylistScript)
- Streamlined Services - Removed PlaylistScriptExecutor and Python integration

### Bug Fixes
- Fixed JavaScript loading issue (moved script tag inside content container)
- Fixed userId parameter requirement for CreatePlaylists endpoint
- Removed test messages from playlist container

### Statistics
- 30% smaller codebase
- DLL size: 159 KB
- Pure C# implementation (no Python)

**Coming in v0.6.0:** Multi-universe system with JSON editor in web UI

## v0.5.1 - Auto-Configuration

**WARNING: BETA VERSION - Not Production Ready**

### New Features
- Auto-Create Configuration File - Default config file created automatically on first install
- Embedded Template - Example timeline included with 3 MCU movies
- Simplified Setup - No manual file creation needed

### Improvements
- Removed unused API key field (we use internal API now)
- Simplified configuration page with documentation links
- Better first-time user experience
- Configuration file appears at /config/timeline_manager_config.json automatically

### Changes
- Removed JellyfinApiKey from PluginConfiguration (not needed)
- Updated config page to show documentation instead of settings
- Plugin creates default config on initialization if missing

### Documentation
- Config page now shows file location and API endpoints
- Links to GitHub repository for full documentation

## v0.5.0 - Playlist Creation

**WARNING: BETA VERSION - Not Production Ready**

### New Features
- Automatic Playlist Creation - Create Jellyfin playlists from your configuration
- POST /Timeline/CreatePlaylists - New API endpoint to generate playlists
- User ID Support - Pass userId as query parameter or via X-Emby-UserId header
- Direct IPlaylistManager Integration - Uses internal Jellyfin API for reliable playlist creation

### Improvements
- Playlists created with items in chronological order
- Reports found vs missing items
- Comprehensive logging for debugging
- Handles existing playlists gracefully (skip with message)
- File system based playlist detection

### API Changes
- New endpoint: POST /Timeline/CreatePlaylists?userId={userId}
- Requires admin authentication
- Returns detailed response with playlist results

### Documentation
- Updated README.md with playlist creation examples
- Added PowerShell and curl examples
- Included test script for validation

### Bug Fixes
- Fixed FindExistingPlaylistAsync to work without user context
- Resolved authentication issues with internal API calls
- Improved error handling and reporting

## v0.4.0 - Season Support

**WARNING: BETA VERSION - Not Production Ready**

### New Features
- Season Support - Specify individual seasons for TV shows (e.g., Loki S1, Loki S2)
- Improved Validation - Better display of TV series with season numbers
- TMDB Caching - Faster validation with cached TMDB lookups

### Improvements
- Increased HTTP timeout to 30 seconds for better reliability
- Optimized concurrent requests (reduced to 3 for stability)
- Added caching to prevent duplicate TMDB requests
- Better handling of series with multiple seasons

### Configuration Changes
- New optional season property for episode items
- Example: {"providerId": "84958", "providerName": "tmdb", "type": "episode", "season": 1}
- See CONFIGURATION.md for complete examples

### Documentation
- Updated CONFIGURATION.md with season support examples
- Added examples for separating seasons in chronological order

## v0.3.0 - Beta Release

**WARNING: BETA VERSION - Not Production Ready**

This is a beta release for testing purposes. Features may change.

### Features
- REST API - Validate and manage configurations via HTTP endpoints
- Library Validation - API checks if configured items exist in your Jellyfin library
- JSON Configuration - Simple file-based configuration
- Comprehensive Documentation - See CONFIGURATION.md for complete guide

### API Endpoints
- GET /Timeline/Test - Test API connection
- GET /Timeline/Config - Get current configuration
- POST /Timeline/Validate - Validate configuration and check library
- POST /Timeline/Save - Save configuration

**Note:** This is API-only. No web UI. Configuration via JSON file editing.
